intro: Daphnandra apatela, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Daphnandra apatela thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
